descript.abstract:
This dataset depicts the location and development status of planned transitway stations that are along a transitway in the 2040 Transportation Policy Plan. Currently, the file includes planned stations locations for those transitways where stations have been identified through a local process including: Southwest LRT (Green Line Extension), Bottineau LRT (Blue Line Extension), Cedar Avenue BRT Future Stages (Red Line), I-35W BRT (Orange Line), Gateway BRT (Gold Line), Red Rock BRT, and planned A Line Arterial BRT stations.
Stations and station points are placed at locations that generally represent the latest official project action by the lead agency. For transitways in early design, this could be as generalized as a point at the intersection and this file is not a guarantee of future station locations until they are under construction or in operation.
The point dataset was created by using heads-up digitizing referencing aerial photography. When transitway construction is completed and service begins, the stations will move from this file to TransitwayStations (existing).
Additional Notes: -Rachel Wiken is main contact for stations which are not part of the ABRT System.
ABRT Station locations are managed by: Katie Roth, Project Manager Metro Transit BRT/Small Starts Project Office 560 6th Ave N Minneapolis, MN 55411 612-349-7772 katie.roth@metrotransit.org
- The A Line stations at Snelling & Como will be located on the exit ramps, not in an online configuration as shown. The purpose of the current point is to show that there will be stations at Snelling and Como Avenues.
- Downtown Minneapolis and Saint Paul BRT station locations have yet to be determined. Stations shown are conceptual.
descript.purpose: To have a general depiction of the planned transitway stations.
descript.supplinf: Twin Cities 7 county metropolitan area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington.

timeperd.current:
- Southwest LRT (Green Line Extension): Metropolitan Council revised project scope action, July 22 2015 - Bottineau LRT (Blue Line Extension): Metropolitan Council LPA adoption, May 8 2013 - Cedar Avenue BRT Future Stages (Red Line): (Pending) Dakota County Regional Railroad Authority “Implementation Plan Update” adoption, Oct 2015 - I-35W BRT (Orange Line): Metropolitan Council “Orange Line Project Plan Update” adoption, July 9 2014* - Gateway BRT (Gold Line): (Pending) Washington County Regional Railroad Authority amended LPA adoption, Oct 2015 - Red Rock BRT: Washington County Regional Railroad Authority “Alternatives Analysis Update Study” adoption of support of findings, April 15 2014** - A Line Arterial BRT: Metropolitan Council “A Line Bus Rapid Transit Recommendation Plan” adoption, July 9 2014
*Station locations in Burnsville-area may shift pending negotiations during the design process in early 2016 **Station locations will likely shift in early 2016 once the Red Rock Implementation Plan is adopted

theme.themekey: transit, light rail, commuter rail, bus stops, transportation, BRT, LRT, planned alignment, transitway, planned transitway stations, planned transitway alignments

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County

citeinfo.title: Transit Stops, Transit Routes, Planned Transitway Alignments

horizpa.horizpar: Station locations were created using heads-up digitizing while referencing aerial photography.

procstep.procdesc: The geography for this dataset was created referencing aerial photography and estimating the centerpoint of each station.

spdoinfo.mgmg3til: One layer for entire Hiawatha Light Rail line.

overview.eaover:
POINT ATTRIBUTES:
STATION: The name of the transitway station.
****A Note about Bottineau Light Rail Stations**** Selection of either a Golden Valley Road Station * or Plymouth Avenue Station * will be made in the future based on information from environmental impact review, engineering, and public involvement.
X: The longitude in decimal degrees.
Y: The latitude in decimal degrees.
Name: Name of the route which is served by the station
Type: Type of route served by station
Transitway: Transitway name
Milestone: Station Milestone Status - the transitway / station status as moves from initial planning to development to engineering and finally construction. Operational transitway stations are moved to another dataset “TransitwayStations”
StationID: Existing shared station IDs match the StationID field in the TransitwayStations file. Planned stations are labeled 900 and above. Arterial BRT stations are labeled 999 until operational.
